title: Camera and Sound issues
text: I constantly have issues with the camera killing the sound to my computer when I turn it on. The only fix is a reboot. I like the overall integration of Teams but it is buggy.

title: Nonsense
text: Had to download this app for work. Tried to just open Teams in a browser, but after logging in and being sent a verification code, I was told I‚Äôd have to download the Teams app. Ok, so I download the app. Log in again and sent a verification code again. Only now to be told now I need the Windows Verification app. So I get that. Sign in and request a verification code, only for Microsoft to say I‚Äôve hit the limit on verification codes I can be sent in a day‚Ä¶..deleted both off my phone and told work to contact me through email. Just want to check Teams, don‚Äôt want to have to download 2 apps just to do it. Come-on Microsoft.

title: Closes Open Chat frequently
text: If it is out of focus for more than a few minutes it will close the chat you have selected and when glance back it will just be a grey screen instead of that chat you are trying to monitor. Very annoying that I have to reselect ever time. Still works at least.

title: Bug in sending messages
text: Sometimes when I try to send a chat message, the send button disappears and it wants me to audio record a message instead. I have to force quit and restart to send the chat message. Annoying and disruptive to work conversations.

title: Crash
text: Recent update crashes when you enter the apps settings. I‚Äôve redownloaded & ensured was also update iOS & teams. Crashes every time.

title: Almost there
text:
This is a great app and I don‚Äôt have a lot too say in a negative context. However there is one thing I have noticed. There seems to be a sync issue sometimes between the app and desktop, while it seems the issue maybe more a desktop problem it is an annoyance on the phone. For some reason after checking a comment/activity in the desktop the information is not synced to my phone. So it shows as a missed message. All in all it‚Äôs nothing major, but can be annoying at first. 

Other than that the app is great call quality is great, the UI is simple and intuitive, and performance is amazing for all it can do.

title: Anxiety Inducing But Works
text: I work on-call for an IT Team of 80 people. I‚Äôm a network engineer. The app works great and I enjoy keeping up with coworkers, but, this is a two sided sword. I get messages at all times throughout the night. But the app works. Send help. Please.

title: This version does not support university accounts
text: It‚Äôs incredibly disappointing to be misled by Microsoft. This launch version of Microsoft Teams for Vision Pro does not support managed accounts. That means most corporate and higher education customers of Office 365, who are heavily dependent on Teams for virtual meetings, are not able to use this version of Teams. This needs to be fixed immediately the application is worthless without it.

title: Need improvement
text: it keeps freezing . Need more improvements .

title: Not keeping up to date with real user needs
text: Unfortunately, the TEAMS app STILL does not support external camera‚Äôs - a key feature for iPad users who don‚Äôt want to look like there staring off into the distance during meetings and a big part of the iOS 17 update.

title: Well rounded but missing one critical feature
text: This seems like a no brainer and I‚Äôm truly surprised this is not standard yet. When utilizing mobile for calls with video, there should be a function included that can be toggled on and off through settings (for those who don‚Äôt find this useful) where the trigger is the user selecting ‚Äúcamera on‚Äù which would create the action of populating a text box requesting confirmation of turning camera on while using mobile. We have seen so many embarrassing stories of people accidentally sharing their video and it‚Äôs not an appropriate time. This function would help to lessen those events and protect the user by working as a fail safe barrier‚Ä¶.Just a thought üôÑ

title: One small thing to correct
text: Need a way to have the mobile app change status to ‚Äúaway‚Äù or ‚Äúunavailable ‚Äú while connected to CarPlay or Android Auto.

title: Please add Microsoft Authenticator
text: This app is useless without it

title: Glitchy and ruined an interview
text: Had a really important interview bomb because the application was so glitchy, very frustrating and I wish I could get my time back from it. Terrible app..

title: No support for manage to accounts
text: A very interesting move for Microsoft considering that nearly 2/3 of their Teams users use managed accounts, making this app completely useless. Please update!

title: Bring back the dots
text:
My AirPods do not work well with Teams. There is a severe lag and when I take them out, I typically have to restart to switch to default audio. 

Also, the chat dots have been a huge reason why I keep using Teams for chats. Those have gone away!  Please bring them back.

title: Teams is great
text: It is easy to use even for 55 years of old man who is not very tech-savvy. Good job on this app!

title: Add Device to call broken

title: Great tool for companies
text:
This is a great tool for companies! We have several locations and departments but with teams it‚Äôs easy to connect with anyone in the company thru message, phone, video or conference call.
I absolutely love it game changer

title: Works well
text: So far everything is working well. I connected to my work account, and I can see all of my meetings in Calendar as well as chat and respond to messages. I wish I was able to screen share while on Apple Vision Pro, but this is only the first generation, and I hope it will get better over time it‚Äôs available on day one

title: Screen Sharing
text:
This app does NOT require company, that is dependant on each company‚Äôs Azure environment setup and policies! I see this app all day with my companies domain just fine.

However, there is no ability to share a window! I get not being able to share the entire ‚Äúspatial computing‚Äù environment but I should be able to share a window with its others like with my iPhone and iPad! Otherwise this is just a Teams companion app!

title: Needs authenticator support
text: I‚Äôm not able to use any of the Microsoft 365 apps on my Vision Pro because it says that authenticator needs to be installed on the device. While I understand that this is because my company has strict policies, Microsoft should be offering authenticator device to allow for use in a corporate environment. As soon as they fix this, I look forward to using the app.

title: Needs Microsoft Authenticator support
text: Useless without Authenticator support for company accounts

title: Time zone info needs to be clearly shown
text: I use this for scheduling meetings with people in multiple time zones and travel a lot. When creating a meeting in the app it does not say anywhere what time zone the meeting is being set for. I have no idea if it‚Äôs the timezone I‚Äôm currently in, the time zone where I normally login when home, the time zone for the people I‚Äôm meeting with, etc. This app is completely useless to me without that feature.

title: 4/5 and why
text: I like how easy it is to talk to my coworkers and those in our company. The calls are fairly straightforward to set up, I wish the audio settings were a little more intuitive during meetings but that may be something from my company‚Äôs side that‚Äôs the issue. I also would like it if I could add my own gifs, somehow, rather than the gifs provided by Teams. Other than those little things, pretty good if you want a fairly dynamic way of communicating with your team.

title: What‚Äôs the point?
text: I can‚Äôt even use this with my business account in education. Having Teams is an essential application to my workflow, it‚Äôs how I communicate with all of my colleagues. This is super unfortunate. May have to return Vision Pro for this reason.

In addition, there‚Äôs no option to remove the ‚Äúpinned channels‚Äù from the app, even though I don‚Äôt have any pin channels - so it‚Äôs an utter waste of space. the notifications on my phone don‚Äôt sync with my desktop version, so I‚Äôm constantly getting dual notifications all day long, every day. This is yet another example of a really annoying totally user unfriendly Microsoft product.

title: Super frustrated with recent update
text: I use Teams on my phone to take work meetings without needing to sign into a Microsoft account. It used to work great. Since a recent update though, joining a meeting without signing in is a terrible process. When I click the Join link in my email, it no longer puts me directly into the meeting; it makes me enter the Meeting ID and Passcode manually. To do that, I need to copy the ID from my email, switch apps, and paste it into Teams, then switch back to email, copy the passcode‚Ä¶ and AUGH when I switch back to Teams, it has backed out automatically to the Sign In screen, which means my Meeting ID is gone. I literally had to copy the Meeting ID and Passcode into a notes app, put them together as one string of text, copy that text, paste it into the Teams Meeting ID field, then select and cut the Passcode part on its own so that I could paste in both pieces of data that I needed without leaving the Teams app (and losing my progress). Microsoft WHY did you make joining a meeting without signing in so difficult and bad?? I promise you that no matter how annoying you make it, I am not going to sign in on my phone, even though that‚Äôs clearly what you want and what you‚Äôre prioritizing. Please fix this, thank you.

title: Easy to use
text: Teams just keeps improving and I love how easy it is to switch between accounts
